metadata.title: CVE-2022-24918 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An authenticated user can create a link with reflected Javascript codeinside it for itemsâ€™ page and send it to other users. The payload can beexecuted only with a known CSRF token value of the victim, which is changedperiodically and is difficult to predict. Malicious code has access to allthe same objects as the rest of the web page and can make arbitrarymodifications to the contents of the page being displayed to a victimduring social engineering attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-agent2 - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-frontend-php - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-java-gateway - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-server-mysql - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 5.0.21rc1
zabbix-web-service - 5.0.21rc1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.21rc1').
